description: This file appears to be a source code file written in Python, responsible for generating C++ code for JSON-RPC interface registration, including emitting event handlers, method registrations, and versioning, based on a schema input.

methods.name: EmitEvent(emit, root, event, params_type, legacy = False)
methods.description: Generates C++ code for a JSON-RPC event emitter based on the provided event data, handling different parameter types and legacy modes.

methods.name: _EmitRpcPrologue(root, emit, header_file, source_file, ns, data_emitted, prototypes = [])
methods.description: Produces the header part of the generated C++ code, including includes, namespace declarations, and version code.

methods.name: _EmitRpcEpilogue(root, emit, ns)
methods.description: Closes off the namespace blocks and finalizes the generated code's structure.

methods.name: _EmitVersionCode(emit, version)
methods.description: Emits C++ namespace versioning constants for RPC versioning.

methods.name: _EmitRpcCode(root, emit, ns, header_file, source_file, data_emitted)
methods.description: Creates the core of the RPC registration code, including method and event registration into the JSONRPC object.

methods.name: EmitRpcCode(root, emit, header_file, source_file, data_emitted)
methods.description: Coordinates emission of full RPC code, including prologue and epilogue.

methods.name: EmitRpcVersionCode(root, emit, header_file, source_file, data_emitted)
methods.description: Emits version namespace and version constants for the RPC interface.
